notesStmt.note: Eli'ezer bar Yehudah ha-Rofe of L'Aquila: inscribed (folio 1r). A contract of sale, folio 140r, of the present manuscript by Refa'el ben Yitsḥaḳ ha-Rofe of Rieto to the heirs of Mosheh ha-Rofe of L'Aquila. Several censor's erasures, by Andrea del Monte (active in the second half of the 16th century), inscribed (folio 139v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The revised recension of Maimonides' Sefer mitsṿot in the Hebrew translation of Mosheh ibn Tibon.

collation.p: 14 quires of 10 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires, partly cut away.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black leather. Spine title: 'Maimonides. Liber Preceptorum. Ex Versione Mosis ben Tibbon. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis 15,421. Plut.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): purchased from him by the British Museum on 18 January 1845, sale lot 295: inscribed (folio ).
